basics.name: Yun-Jin (Jim) Li
basics.label: Master's Student
basics.summary: I’m pursuing my Master's degree at TUM. My research interest lies in the area of computer vision, deep learning, and autonomous driving.

work.name: Infineon Technologies AG
work.summary: Setup radar DSP preprocessing stack and the entire ML infrastructure from data collection, annotation and loader. Design an end‑to‑end transformer‑based neural network for radar material classification aiming to lawn mower and vacuum cleaner robot. Setup the solution for deploying/compiling our transformer‑based model onto bare‑metal device (PSoC6) using TFLITE/TVM framwork.

education.institution: Technical University of Munich, Bayern, Germany
education.studyType: M. Sc in Robotics, Cognition, Intelligence
courses: The Evolution of Motion Estimation and Real‑time 3D Reconstruction (SE)

education.institution: National Tsing Hua University, Hsinchu, Taiwan
education.studyType: B. Sc in Power Mechanical Engineering

publications.name: VXP: Voxel-Cross-Pixel Large-scale Image-LiDAR Place Recognition

skills.name: Programming
keywords: C/C++ (OpenCV, OpenGV, Ceres, Eigen, Sophus, CMake)

projects.name: Visual-SLAM: Loop Closure and Relocalization
projects.summary: Extend the Visual Odometry framework into Visual SLAM system, and achieve an outstanding performance on EuRoC Vicon Room 1 and EuRoC Machine Hall dataset.

projects.name: Visual-Inertial Tracking using Preintegrated Factors
projects.summary: Extend the Visual Odometry framework into Visual‑Inertial Odometry. Instead of performing local bundle adjustment by minimizing the reprojection errors in the sliding window of keyframes, we compute preintegrated factor from the IMU measurement to serve as a constraint in the loss function to make the optimization more robust.

projects.name: Graph Attention Network for Social Navigation (GAT4SN)
projects.summary: Come up with a GNN‑inspired model named GAT4SN (Graph Attention Network for Social Navigation).
